RefSummary.name: Scope of survey
RefSummary.DefaultValue: The scope of hull structural surveys, that were carried out with regards to ultrasonic thickness measurements and the 'overall' and 'close up' visual inspections of the structure and coatings, is identified in the Bureau Veritas Guidance Note NI 465 DT R01 E, May 2015, in conjunction with NI 623 DT R00 E, May 2015, in case of LNG Carriers specifically.

RefSummary.name: Vessel structural History
RefSummary.DefaultValue: A Ship History Review has been carried out to identified the areas with an history of recurring structural defects... Details of the review can be found in the Structural History Review Section 2

RefSummary.name: Structural and Fatigue Analysis
RefSummary.DefaultValue: A structural and Fatigue Analysis was carried out with the following results (Complete report to be be found in annex)

RefSummary.name: Local Strength of Plates and Stiffeners Assessment
Area to monitor
RefSummary.DefaultValue: Following review of the vessel’s structural history, structural and fatigue analysis results and the outcome of CAP close up surveys, a list of items that should be monitored by the vessel’s crew and class has been assembled. This list can be found within the Monitoring plan of this CAP report

RefSummary.name: Structural Condition on completion of the Survey
RefSummary.DefaultValue: Details of surveys carried out, defects found, repairs carried out and ratings applied to the various vessel sections, areas under consideration (AUCs) and items can be found in the Cap Hull Structure Report.

RefSummary.name: Scope of survey
RefSummary.DefaultValue: The scope of hull and cargo machinery, fittings and systems surveys that were carried out is identified in the Bureau Veritas Guidance Note NI 465 DT R01 E, May 2015, in conjunction with NI 623 DT R00 E, May 2015, in case of LNG Carriers specifically.

RefSummary.name: General Condition
RefSummary.DefaultValue: Full details of the surveys/modifications/repairs that were carried out are described within the Hull and Cargo Machinery Report of this CAP report. This document contains ratings awarded for equipment on completion of the CAP surveys together with photographic records.

RefSummary.name: Scope of survey
RefSummary.DefaultValue: The scope of propulsion and auxiliaries machinery, fittings and systems surveys that were carried out is identified in the Bureau Veritas Guidance Note NI 465 DT R01 E, May 2015, in conjunction with NI 623 DT R00 E, May 2015, in case of LNG Carriers specifically.

RefSummary.name: General Condition
RefSummary.DefaultValue: Full details of the surveys/modifications/repairs that were carried out are described within the propulsion and auxiliaries Machinery Report of this CAP report. This document contains ratings awarded for equipment on completion of the CAP surveys together with photographic records.

RefSummary.name: Scope of survey
RefSummary.DefaultValue: The scope of bridge, navigational and radio equipment and systems surveys that were carried out is identified in the Bureau Veritas Guidance Note NI 465 DT R01 E, May 2015, in conjunction with NI 623 DT R00 E, May 2015, in case of LNG Carriers specifically.

RefSummary.name: General Condition
RefSummary.DefaultValue: Full details of the surveys that were carried out are described within the bridge, navigational and radio equipment and systems Report of this CAP report. This document contains ratings awarded together with photographic records.

RefSummary.name: Scope of survey
RefSummary.DefaultValue: The scope of Cargo Containment System surveys that were carried out is identified in the Bureau Veritas Guidance Note NI 623 DT R00 E ,May 2015.

RefSummary.name: General Condition
RefSummary.DefaultValue: Full details of the surveys that were carried out are described within the Cargo Containment System Report of this CAP report. This document contains ratings awarded together with photographic records of each Cargo space.

Rule.value: MSG(On Completion of the CAP survey :)
MSG(The rating good condition has been assigned to the %NAME()%.)
MSG(The rating fair condition has been assigned to the %NAME()%.)
MSG(The rating poor condition has been assigned to the %NAME()%.)
MSG(The rating fair has been assigned to the %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_001;3)))% for the visual structure assessment.)
MSG(The rating poor has been assigned to the %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_001;4)))% for the visual structure assessment.)
MSG(Some areas of substantial corrosion have been found on the %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_003;3)))%.)
MSG(Some areas with excessive corrosion have been found on the %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_003;4)))%.)
MSG(No area of substantial corrosion has been found.)
MSG(The measured wastage has not been assessed in way of %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_003;NS)))%.)
MSG(The measured wastage assessment has been found to be not applicable in way of %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_003;NA)))%.)
MSG(Some areas with poor coating condition have been found on the %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_002;3)))%.)
MSG(No area with coating condition less than fair has been found.)
MSG(No area with coating condition less than good has been found.)
MSG(The %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_002;NC)))% are not coated as per original design.)
MSG(The coating condition has not been assessed in way of %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_002;NS)))%.)
MSG(The coating condition assessment has been found to be not applicable in way of %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_002;NA)))%.)

MSG(Considering the rating 4 has been assigned for %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(R_RA_004;4)))% for %NAME(RATINGS_ALL(AND(EQUALS(VALUE();4);EQUALS(ID();OR(R_RA_001;R_RA_002;R_RA_003)))))%, the Structural Condition Rating has been revised to 4.)

MSG(Considering the rating %R_RA_008% has been assigned to %NAME(ELEMENTS_MAJOR(EQUALS(OR(R_RA_001;R_RA_003);FATHER(R_RA_008))))% for %NAME(RATINGS_ALL_MAJOR(AND(EQUALS(VALUE();FATHER(FATHER(R_RA_008)));EQUALS(ID();OR(R_RA_001;R_RA_003)))))%, the Structural Condition Rating has been revised to %R_RA_008%.)

MSG(Considering the rating 3 has been assigned to %NAME(ELEMENTS(EQUALS(OR(R_RA_001;R_RA_002;R_RA_003);3)))% for %NAME(RATINGS_ALL(AND(EQUALS(VALUE();3);EQUALS(ID();OR(R_RA_001;R_RA_002;R_RA_003)))))%, the Structural Condition Rating has been revised to 2.).

RefGeneralConditionQuestion.name: 1. Was the period for CAP and inspection within a 6-month window?
2. Is the Hull Girder Strength (HGS) evaluation without significant changes?(HGSA or HGSM > 96% of as-built)
3. Was the required scantling re-assessed to the current rule requirement?
4. Is the hull gauging with only superficial reductions from as-built?(Rating 1 for all S-curves)
5. Did an approved conctractor carry out the thickness measurement?
6. Did all regions of hull coating achieve a rating of "Good"?
7. If the vessel is designed with shedder plates, were these inspected during the current CAP survey?
8. If the vessel is fitted with overboard exhaust scrubbers, were these inspected during the current CAP survey?
9. Were all structural issues satisfactorily addressed with no outstanding condition of class?

RefFandFQuestion.name: 1. Were there hot spots identified in the fatigue analysis report?
2. If hot spots were identified, were cracks found from the close-up survey of the hot spots?
3. If hot spots were identified, were these added to the PMS?
4. Were cracks identified in the current CAP survey?
5. Is the vessel historical review free of crack/fracture?
6. Where cracks have been identified, was any of the crack repetitive?
7. Where cracks have been identified, have these been found in similar locations in the vessel?
8. Where cracks have been identified, were these cracks permanently repaired?
9. Where crack repairs have been carried out, were modifications considered to avoid future occurrence?
10. Were all issues with cracks satisfactorily addressed?

RefDamagesndRepairQuestion.name: 1. Is the vessel historical review free of substantial wastage?
2. Where wastage was identified, was it adequately repaired with no additional stiffening and double plate, other than those currently used around manholes/lightening holes?
3. Is the vessel historical review free of significant contact damage?
4. Where contact damage was identified, was it repaired as per the original?
5. Is the vessel historical review free of serious fire damage?
6. Where fire damage has occurred, were the affected structures repaired as per the original?
7. Is the historical review free of substantial structural modifications since its construction?
8. Were there any repairs done to the watertight boundary (Bottom Shell, Side Shell, Main Deck, or watertight bulkhead) during the current CAP survey?
9. Where repairs have been carried out, were all repairs subjected to adequate NDT?
10 Were all repairs satisfactorily addressed in accordance with the Class approved as built arrangements?
